syllabus:
Public Speaking: Presentation

**Learning objectives:**

This course aims to introduce you to the basics of interpersonal communication and public presentation skills. You will develop your English presentation skills by honing the basics of word choice, paragraph organization and delivery systematically through a process approach to be more familiar with the structure of effective presentations for different audiences on various occasions. You will also learn how to use the tools learned in class to become an inspiring and effective professional presenter in English.

**From this course:**

1\. Students will be able to learn the effective techniques to develop professional presentations;

2\. Students will be able to learn the art of professional presentations;

3. Students will be able to appreciate and critique different presentations on various occasions

**Course requirements:**

Students will give two prepared presentations for midterm (40%) and final (40%) in this semester. Assessment rubrics will entail the topics covered in class to see what you have learned from our weekly discussion. 

Attendance is crucial to succeed in this course. Sick and personal leaves will be permitted only if email notifications have been received before the meeting. Late arrivals of more than 15 minutes will be deemed absence and will result in a deduction of 4 out of 20 of your attendance score. 

**Class schedule:**

1\. Introduction: speaking professionally for presentations

2\. Speaking on special occasions

3\. Presenting in small groups I

4\. Presenting in small groups II

5\. Presentation core concepts: introducing the objective

6\. Presentation slides: outlining the structure

7\. A basic presentation: introducing the main body

8\. Midterm presentation I

9\. Midterm presentation II

10\. Introducing a company 

11\. Explaining the management structure 

12\. A perfect product launch 

13\. Talking your product up: signpost language 

14\. A promotion plan: using visual aids

15\. Final presentation I

16\. Final presentation II
